snippet: A year after the insurance marketplaces were introduced as part of the Affordable Care Act, provisions meant to help small businesses offer benefits to employees have yet to fulfill their promise.
abstract: Provisions in Affordable Care Act that were supposed to help small businesses offer employee health benefits are largely seen as failure, year after law's introduction of insurance exchanges; many small-business owners are looking for health insurance solutions.
lead_paragraph: A year after the insurance marketplaces were introduced as part of the Affordable Care Act, provisions meant to help small businesses offer benefits to employees have yet to fulfill their promise.

headline.main: Providing Health Insurance Still a Struggle for Small Business

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
